body: This makes it so if mono_time is overridden, no monotonic time-related system call is invoked in tox_new. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/2206)

comment_data.body: I see lock and unlock, but no init or deinit, missing or not needed?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,142 @@
+/* SPDX-License-Identifier: GPL-3.0-or-later
+ * Copyright © 2016-2022 The TokTok team.
+ * Copyright © 2013 Tox project.
+ */
+
+/**
+ * The Tox private API (for tests).
+ */
+#include "tox_private.h"
+
+#include <assert.h>
+
+#include "ccompat.h"
+#include "tox_struct.h"
+
+#define SET_ERROR_PARAMETER(param, x) \
+    do {                              \
+        if (param != nullptr) {       \
+            *param = x;               \
+        }                             \
+    } while (0)
+
+const Tox_System tox_default_system = {
+    nullptr,  // mono_time_callback
+    nullptr,  // mono_time_user_data
+};
+
+void tox_lock(const Tox *tox)

comment_data.body: This was moved out of tox.c. I really don't want to touch the pthread stuff in this PR.

comment_data.body: Why put the function call outside the conditional? Inside would be cleaner IMHO and independent of side effects of `tox_default_system()`
I'd expect `_free(...)` type functions to generally be nullable. Is this a conscious decision against this convention?

That would mean making default_system non-const. Would you prefer splitting the definition and initialisation, making the value non-const and uninitialised by default to avoid side effects of `tox_default_system()`?
Maybe not, but you tell me to stop doing multiple things per PR and then you tell me to change nullability of functions I'm not touching (only reformatting)?
misread the purpose of this code

I'm ok with multiple things per PR, as long as they are separate commits or properly explained. I didn't quite see that this was only moved, but nevertheless it's strange and warants a comment. As agreed on IRC this will be globally changed.

commit.message:
refactor: Allow overriding mono_time in tox_new.

This makes it so if mono_time is overridden, no monotonic time-related
system call is invoked in tox_new.

refactor: Allow overriding mono_time in tox_new.

This makes it so if mono_time is overridden, no monotonic time-related
system call is invoked in tox_new.

labels.description: New feature for the user, not a new feature for build script
labels.name: enhancement

title: feat: Allow overriding mono_time in tox_new.
